intro: Strobilanthes inflata var. gongshanensis, commonly known as the Gongshan strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, inflated bracts that resemble small balloons. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
